vr scene
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Creating a simple VR scene using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript can be done using the A-Frame framework, which is a popular choice for building VR experiences on the web. Below is a complete example of a VR scene embedded in a single HTML file. You can copy and paste this code into an HTML file and open it in a web browser that supports WebVR.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Simple VR Scene</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body {
            margin: 0;
            overflow: hidden;
        }
        a-scene {
            display: block;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene>
        <!-- Sky -->
        <a-sky color="#87CEEB"></a-sky>

        <!-- Ground -->
        <a-plane position="0 0 -4" rotation="-90 0 0" width="10" height="10" color="#7BC8A4"></a-plane>

        <!-- Box -->
        <a-box position="-1 0.5 -3" rotation="0 45 0" color="#4CC3D2"></a-box>

        <!-- Sphere -->
        <a-sphere position="1 1 -3" radius="1.25" color="#EF2D5E"></a-sphere>

        <!-- Cylinder -->
        <a-cylinder position="0 0.75 -3" radius="0.5" height="1.5" color="#FFC65D"></a-cylinder>

        <!-- Light -->
        <a-light type="ambient" color="#FFFFFF"></a-light>
        <a-light type="directional" position="-1 2 1" intensity="0.5"></a-light>

        <!-- Camera -->
        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>
    </a-scene>

    <script>
        // You can add custom JavaScript here if needed
        console.log("VR Scene Loaded");
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

### Instructions to Use:
1. Copy the above code into a text editor.
2. Save the file with a `.html` extension, for example, `vr_scene.html`.
3. Open the file in a web browser that supports WebVR (like Chrome or Firefox).
4. You can use a VR headset or simply navigate using your mouse or keyboard.

### Explanation:
- **A-Frame**: This framework is included via a CDN link, allowing you to create 3D and VR experiences easily.
- **Scene Elements**: The scene includes a sky, ground plane, a box, a sphere, and a cylinder, along with ambient and directional lights.
- **Camera**: The camera is set up to allow user interaction through look controls.
- **CSS**: Basic styles are applied to remove margins and ensure the scene takes up the full screen.

Feel free to modify the positions, colors, and shapes to create your own unique VR experience!
